excerpt: War museum with information on historic battles, plus a collection of weapons, armor & uniforms.
detail_description: The Maharaja Ranjit Singh War Museum, established in 1999 by the Punjab Government, is a tribute to the soldiers who fought in historic battles. Located on the GT road in Ludhiana and spanning four acres, it houses a collection of weapons, armor, and uniforms. The museum aims to honor the soldiers' contributions to defense and features a striking statue of Maharaja Ranjit Singh at its entrance.
name: Maharaja Ranjit Singh War Museum
address: Grand Trunk Rd, Bhattian, Ludhiana, Punjab 141008, India

excerpt: Fortress dating to around the 15th century, now fallen into disrepair & only viewable from outside.
detail_description: Lodhi Fort, also known as Purana Qila, is a historic fortress in Ludhiana dating back to the 15th century. Built by the Muslim monarch Sikandar Lodhi, it once showcased his military power and grandeur. Despite its current state of disrepair, the fort still retains its allure and draws tourists who wish to explore its ancient lanes.
name: Lodhi Fort (Purana Qila)
address: WVF2+MJ4, Shivpuri Rd, Qila Mohalla, Near, Chhawani Mohalla, Ludhiana, Punjab 141008, India

detail_description: Nehru Rose Garden, established in 1967, spans over 30 acres and boasts more than 17,000 plants with 1600 diverse rose species. As one of Asia's largest rose gardens, it offers a picturesque setting for morning and evening walks, yoga, meditation, and family picnics. The garden features fountains, various types of roses and trees that are beautifully illuminated at night. Visitors can also enjoy street food outside the garden gates.
name: Nehru Rose Garden
address: WR4G+X36, Government College Rd, Near Government College, New Prem Nagar, Civil Lines, Ludhiana, Punjab 141001, India

excerpt: Leafy park with bicycle rentals & fitness equipment, plus picnic lawns & a colorful mini train.
detail_description: Rakh Bagh, situated in Ludhiana, is a sprawling 57-acre park known for its lush greenery and diverse attractions. It boasts over 200 species of birds, making it one of India's largest bird sanctuaries and a haven for birdwatchers. The park features landscaped gardens, walking trails, and picnic lawns where families can relax amidst the natural beauty.
name: Rakh Bagh
address: WR6V+996, Club Rd Rounabout, Gandhi Nagar, Koh - E - Fiza, Ludhiana, Punjab 141001, India

excerpt: Unassuming outdoor zoo featuring a royal Bengal tiger, plus a bear, emu, porcupine, deer & ducks.
detail_description: Ludhiana Zoo Tiger Safari, established in 1993 and sprawling over 25 acres, is a popular destination for wildlife enthusiasts. The park boasts a variety of flora and fauna, including black buck, Sambhar, rabbits, peacocks, bears, emus, porcupines, deer and ducks. Visitors can opt for an exciting safari to witness majestic tigers roaming freely in the protected jungle areas.
name: Ludhiana Zoo Tiger Safari
address: XR6F+X2Q, Bhattian, Ludhiana, Punjab 141008, India

excerpt: Theme park with a separate waterpark, adrenalin-fueled rides, dining options & live entertainment.
detail_description: Hardy's World, established in Ludhiana in 2004, is a popular destination featuring an amusement park and the largest waterpark in Punjab. It offers adrenalin-fueled rides, dining options, and live entertainment for visitors of all ages. The park is known for being a paradise for kids and a source of fond memories for adults. With its big water rides and delicious food, it provides a reminiscent experience of old school picnics.
name: Hardy's World
address: 1, NH1, Grand Trunk Rd, Ludhiana, Majra Khurd, Punjab 141008, India

detail_description: The Museum of Social History and Rural Life of Punjab, located within the Punjab Agricultural University Campus in Ludhiana, offers a captivating portrayal of the rural lifestyle and cultural heritage of Punjabis. Housed in a charming building that replicates traditional rural houses, the museum showcases an array of artifacts including local art, craftwork, agricultural tools, and equipment. Visitors can explore exhibits featuring kitchen utensils, pulkari textiles, earthenware, photographs from before 1962, and more.
name: Museum of Social History and Rural Life of Punjab
address: VRX4+X2F, Punjab Agricultural University, Ludhiana, Punjab 141004, India

detail_description: Charan Kamal (Tibba Road Ludhiana) Gurudwara is a significant Sikh shrine that holds historical and spiritual importance. It marks the location where Guru Gobind Singh rested after enduring hardships, and it features stunning Sikh architecture. The annual fair in December celebrates the congregation of this holy place. Visitors describe it as a calm, spiritual place where one can easily connect with the divine and find inner peace.
name: Charan Gurdawara (Tibba Road Ludhiana) Gurudwara
address: New ManJeet Nagar, Near 141007, Tibba Road, Gopal Nagar, Subhash Nagar, Ludhiana, Punjab 141007, India

excerpt: Modern mall on 5 levels with global brands, a food court, gaming area, cinema & bowling.
detail_description: Pavilion Mall in Ludhiana, Punjab is a modern 5-level shopping and entertainment complex featuring global brands, a food court, gaming area, cinema, and bowling alley. It's a popular destination for couples offering diverse shopping experiences with brands like Shoppers Stop and Marks & Spencer. The mall also boasts numerous cafes, bars, restaurants, arcades, and PVR cinemas for light-hearted entertainment.
name: Pavilion Mall
address: B-I 1258, Kailash Cinema Rd, Civil Lines, Ludhiana, Punjab 141008, India

detail_description: Gurudwara Nanaksar is a beautiful and peaceful place located near the Verka milk plant. The gurdwara offers free sewa and hosts beautiful kirtan at all times. It's a great place to worship, sing and read Gurbani, and escape from stressful thoughts. The atmosphere is filled with blessings, good vibes, peace, and positivity. Additionally, it provides 24-hour free food and accommodations for travelers.
name: Gurudwara Nanaksar Samrala Chowk Ludhiana
address: Grand Trunk Rd, Samrala Chowk, Guru Arjan Dev Nagar, Ludhiana, Punjab 141012, India

detail_description: Guru Nanak Stadium in Ludhiana is a modern sports arena known for hosting football matches and athletics events, including the opening and closing ceremonies of the 2001 Indian National Games. With a seating capacity of 15,000, it also serves as the home ground for JCT FC club. The stadium was built to international standards at a cost of approximately 15.4 crores and continues to be a popular venue for national and international sports meets.
name: Guru Nanak Stadium
address: Club Road, Opp Rakh Bagh Gate 4, Near Mata Rani Mandir, Gandhi Nagar, Civil Lines, Ludhiana, Punjab 141001, India

detail_description: Punjab Agricultural University, also known as PAU, is a significant institution that offers a firsthand look at the agricultural heritage of Punjab. The university features a museum modeled after the Land Grant College of America, showcasing the state's rural life with farm exhibits, equipment displays, and a photographic exhibition. It is an ideal destination for those interested in learning about the origins and evolution of farming in Punjab.
name: Punjab Agricultural University
address: Ferozepur Rd, Ludhiana, Punjab 141027, India

detail_description: Guru Nanak Dev Bhawan is a magnificent complex in Ludhiana, Punjab, offering versatile facilities. It features a mini auditorium for 200 people and a larger one accommodating up to 900 individuals. The venue hosts various events such as school functions, corporate gatherings, seminars, and stand-up shows. Additionally, it boasts ample parking space and a large library.
name: Guru Nanak Dev Bhawan
address: WR2Q+CFQ, NH 95, Jila Kacheri Area, Model Gram, Ludhiana, Punjab 141001, India

excerpt: Ludhiana is a large industrial city in the north Indian state of Punjab. The Punjab Agricultural University is home to the Museum of Rural Life, which displays pottery, musical instruments and traditional Punjabi clothing. Nearby, leafy Nehru Rose Garden features ornamental fountains and more than one thousand different rose varieties. To the north, Maharaja Ranjit Singh War Museum documents Punjabi military history.
detail_description: Ludhiana, a bustling industrial city in Punjab, India, is home to the Punjab Agricultural University and the Museum of Rural Life. The city also boasts the leafy Nehru Rose Garden with over a thousand rose varieties and the Maharaja Ranjit Singh War Museum documenting Punjabi military history.
name: Ludhiana
address: Punjab, India

excerpt: Sprawling prayer complex with a domed pavilion & marble shrine dedicated to an 18th-century guru.
detail_description: Gurudwara Dukh Niwaran Sahib in Ludhiana is a significant Sikh place of worship with a rich history dating back to the 18th century. Initially established on land donated by Maharaja Ranjit Singh, it is known for its domed pavilion and marble shrine. The gurdwara employs modern technology, using hi-tech projection to display Gurbani on large screens during prayers.
name: Gurudwara Dukh Niwaran Sahib, Ludhiana
address: NH 1, Field Ganj, Towards, East Pass, opp. Jagraon Bridge ( Towards West Pass ), Ludhiana, Punjab 141008, India

excerpt: Red-brick clock tower built in the 1900s in European Gothic Revival style & illuminated after dark.
detail_description: The Clock Tower of Ludhiana, also known as Ghanta Ghar, is a significant landmark in the vibrant city of Ludhiana, Punjab, India. Built in the 1900s in a European Gothic Revival style, this red-brick structure stands as a symbol of freedom and independence. It commemorates the martyrs who fought for justice during World War I and represents the rich history and culture of Ludhiana.
name: Clock Tower of Ludhiana
address: Bank of India, Clock Tower Rd, Guruteg Bahadur, Old Ludhiana, Ludhiana, Punjab 141008, India

detail_description: Rakh Bagh, located in Ludhiana, is a popular park that has been a favorite recreational spot for locals for many years. One of its main attractions is the renowned mini train that runs through the park, especially beloved by children. Taking a delightful ride on this charming train is a must-do when visiting Rakh Bagh.
name: Rakh Bagh
address: Koh - E - Fiza, Ludhiana, Punjab, India

detail_description: Ansal Plaza is a renowned shopping destination in Ludhiana, covering an expansive area and housing a wide array of local and international brand outlets as well as dining establishments. While it was once a bustling hub, the current situation has led to many stores being temporarily closed due to the pandemic. However, fast food chains like McDonald's and KFC remain open for limited hours. Despite this, Ansal Plaza remains an iconic landmark in the city and continues to attract visitors seeking retail therapy or delicious meals.
name: Ansal Plaza
address: 1a, Ferozepur Rd, PAU Gate No. 3, Maharaj Nagar, Ludhiana, Punjab 141004, India

name: Dhiman Taxi Service - Ludhiana se wagah Border & Amritsar Golden Temple Taxi
address: VV82+P3H, Bhai Himmat Singh Nagar, Duggri, Ludhiana, Punjab 141006, India

detail_description: Alamgir Tailors & Drappers is a renowned historical gurudwara near the village of Alamgir, revered by Sikhs due to its association with Guru Gobind Singh. It's surrounded by folklore and is considered a religious destination. The tailor and drapper shop in Miller Ganj and Gill Road area is known for its high-quality stitching and fabrics, attracting satisfied customers from near and far throughout the year.
name: Alamgir Tailors
address: 793 Street Number 5, Gill Rd, Dasmesh Nagar, Industrial Area-B, Ludhiana, Punjab 141001, India

detail_description: PAU Museum, located within the Punjab Agriculture University Campus, offers a captivating glimpse into the rural life and culture of Punjab. Inaugurated in 1974, this museum showcases a wide array of artifacts including household equipment, pottery, coins, musical instruments, traditional attire and jewelry. Visitors can also explore Punjabi juttis (shoes) and handicrafts on display.
name: PAU Museum
address: WR27+58X, Ferozepur Rd, Punjab Agricultural University, Ludhiana, Punjab 141001, India

excerpt: Lively shopping mall with brand-name retailers & a food court, plus a multiplex & kids' gaming zone.
detail_description: Silver Arc Mall is a bustling shopping destination that features a wide array of popular brand-name retailers, a food court offering diverse dining options, and entertainment facilities such as a multiplex and kids' gaming zone. The mall is known for its extensive selection of well-known brands like Mango, Crocs, Tommy Hilfiger, and many more. Visitors can also enjoy dining at the central caf or the buffet restaurant GT ROAD. Additionally, the mall offers valet parking services and maintains clean restroom facilities.
name: Silver Arc Mall
address: 622, Ferozepur Rd, Gurdev Nagar, Ludhiana, Punjab 141001, India

detail_description: Ludhiana Railway Station is a bustling junction on the major Delhi-Amritsar route, serving as an important railway hub with connections to various cities like Jalandhar, Ferozepur, Dhuri, and Delhi. The station is part of the Ferozepur Railway Division and provides daily or weekly trains to major cities across India. Situated in Ludhiana district in Punjab, it holds a central location within the city and is known for its cleanliness.
name: Ludhiana Railway Station
address: railway station, Near Ghanta Ghar, Jagraon bridge entry gate, Ludhiana, Punjab 141001, India

detail_description: Westend Mall is a popular destination in Ludhiana, known for its diverse offerings and convenient location near Rajguru Nagar. It has been a go-to spot for locals for over two decades, offering everything from shopping to entertainment. The mall features a wide range of brands and food outlets, making it suitable for individual or family visits. Visitors can also enjoy the kids' play area and meals at the food court.
name: Westend Mall
address: LG1 WESTEND MALL, Ferozepur Rd, Ludhiana, Punjab 141001, India

detail_description: Ghumar Mandi in Ludhiana is a vibrant shopping district that offers a delightful retail therapy experience. It is bustling with shops offering traditional Punjabi attire, contemporary fashion, local handicrafts, and exquisite jewelry. Whether you're looking for cultural souvenirs or trendy clothing, Ghumar Mandi has something for every shopper.
name: Ghumar Mandi
address: Ludhiana, Punjab 141001, India

detail_description: Prachin Temple Sanglan Shivala is a 400-year-old temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, attracting visitors from around the world. During Shivratri, devotees offer holy water from the Ganges to the idol of Lord Shiva. It is one of the oldest temples in Ludhiana and experiences heavy footfall during Shivaratri Pujan.
name: Prachin Temple Sanglan Shivala
address: WV75+W7M, Wool Market Rd, near Aggarwal Dharamashala, Chaura Bazar, Old Ludhiana, Ludhiana, Punjab 141008, India

detail_description: Ludhiana, a significant town in Punjab, North India, is known as the industrial capital of the state. It boasts a global reputation for its hosiery and woolen garments industry. The city has deep historical roots and is home to notable Gurudwaras and sacred shrines.
name: North India roadways
address: 4, 2nd floor plot no b-23,2908, near, Telephone Exchange Rd, Transport Nagar, Ludhiana, Punjab 141003, India

detail_description: Ludhiana, a city with deep historical roots and rich cultural heritage, is home to some of the most exquisite Gurudwaras and sacred shrines. The warm hospitality of the locals adds to the charm of this place, making it an essential stop for any traveler exploring Punjab. The Gurudwaras in Ludhiana not only offer a divine experience but also play a vital role in community service.
name: Gurudwara
address: 144A, Harnam Nagar, Model Town, Ludhiana, Punjab 141002, India

detail_description: Shri Krishna Mandir in Ludhiana is a beautiful temple spread across 500 sq. ft, housing over 520 statues. It's recommended to spend about an hour for a full tour and visitors are advised not to take pictures inside to avoid any inconvenience. This peaceful and clean temple is dedicated to various Hindu deities, making it a great place for prayer and reflection.
name: Shri Krishna Mandir
address: VRQW+944, Model Town Rd, Pritm Nagar, Model Town, Ludhiana, Punjab 141003, India

detail_description: Ludhiana Zoo, situated near Km. 323-24 in Kadian Reserve Forest, offers a vast area of 56 hectares to explore on the left bank of the Sutlej River. The zoo boasts an impressive variety of animals, making it a fantastic experience for visitors.
name: Ludhiana Zoo
address: Jalandhar Road, Bhattian, Ludhiana, Punjab 141008, India

detail_description: Nehru Planetarium, located within the Nehru Rose Garden, has been a popular destination since its establishment on March 3rd, 1977. It aims to promote scientific curiosity through entertaining and educational experiences. This unique blend of learning and entertainment has made it a favorite among young visitors. The planetarium offers a peaceful and pleasant environment, making it an enjoyable place for children and those interested in astronomy. Visitors appreciate the wealth of knowledge available here, especially for kids.
name: Nehru Planetarium
address: Government College Rd, Rose garden, Civil Lines, Ludhiana, Punjab 141001, India

detail_description: Shri Govind Godham Ludhiana, also known as Gurudwara Shri Manji Sahib, is a significant Sikh religious shrine located in Alamgir village. It holds historical importance as it commemorates the tenth Sikh guru, Guru Govind Singh. The guru's act of shooting an arrow into the ground and creating a spring of water (Tirsar) is remembered here.
name: Shri Govind Godham Ludhiana
address: Gaushala Rd, Partap Singhwala, Ludhiana, Punjab 141008, India

detail_description: PVR Flamez in Ludhiana is a popular movie theater located in the city's bustling entertainment district. It is known for its supportive staff and comfortable seating, making it an ideal spot for a family outing or date night. The theater offers the latest movie releases and provides a luxurious experience for visitors. While some may find ticket prices higher when booking online, it's recommended to purchase tickets at the window to avoid this issue.
name: PVR Flamez, Ludhiana
address: Flamez Mall, 755, Ferozepur Rd, Gurdev Nagar, Ludhiana, Punjab 141002, India

name: Kali Mata mandir
address: VWP5+HC4, Rajiv Gandhi Colony, Urban Estate Phase 1, Jamalpur, Ludhiana, Punjab 141010, India

excerpt: Contemporary venue with stores & boutiques on multiple levels, including a food court & cinema.
detail_description: Wave Mall Ludhiana is a modern shopping complex situated on Moga Road. With multiple levels of retail stores and boutiques, the mall offers a diverse range of products and services including a food court, cinema, and rides for kids at affordable prices. The mall is fully centralized air-conditioned with parking facilities available at basement level for two-wheelers at Rs. 20/- and four-wheeler cars at Rs. 30/-.
name: Wave Mall Ludhiana
address: City Plaza, Plot No. 2 & 3, Ferozepur Rd, Ludhiana, Punjab 141012, India

name: H.S GILL FARM
address: PXFP+66G, Ghudani Kalan, Punjab 141419, India
